alert.note: Alert for Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Northeast Weld County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 6:04PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Weld County through 630 PM MDT... At 604 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout tornado 5 miles south of Grover, or 36 miles northeast of Greeley, moving northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Locations impacted include... Grover and Hereford. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If a tornado is spotted seek shelter inside a sturdy building.

area.areaDesc: Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Northeast Weld County
